description.en: Learn the difference between 'even if' (conditional) and 'even though' (factual) in English.
description.es: Aprende la diferencia entre 'even if' (condicional) y 'even though' (factual) en inglés.

exercises.solution: Even if it rains, I'll go out.

tip.en: 'Even if' means 'aunque/incluso si' and uses conditional structures. It refers to hypothetical situations.
tip.es: 'Even if' significa 'aunque/incluso si' y usa estructuras condicionales. Se refiere a situaciones hipotéticas.

prompt.es: Aunque fueses rico, no serías más feliz.

exercises.solution: Even if you were rich, you wouldn't be any happier.

tip.en: 'Even if' means 'aunque/incluso si' and uses conditional structures. It refers to hypothetical situations.

prompt.es: Nunca llegarás a ser presidente, aunque trabajes mucho.

exercises.solution: You will never become President, even if you work hard.

tip.es: 'Even if' significa 'aunque/incluso si' y usa estructuras condicionales. Se refiere a situaciones hipotéticas.

prompt.es: Aunque lo hubiera sabido, no te lo habría dicho.

exercises.solution: Even if I had known, I wouldn't have told you.

prompt.es: Aunque hubieses estado allí, no habrías sido capaz de hacer nada.

exercises.solution: Even if you had been there, you wouldn't have been able to do anything.

tip.en: 'Even if' means 'aunque/incluso si' and uses conditional structures. It refers to hypothetical situations.

prompt.es: A pesar de que estaba nevando, fuí al concierto.

exercises.solution: Even though it was snowing, I went to the concert.

tip.en: 'Even though' means 'a pesar de que' and refers to real, factual situations. It's another way to say 'in spite of the fact that'.
tip.es: 'Even though' significa 'a pesar de que' y se refiere a situaciones reales y factuales. Es otra forma de decir 'in spite of the fact that'.

prompt.es: A pesar de que es duro, no me voy a rendir.

exercises.solution: Even though it's hard, I'm not going to give up.
